snippet.title: The best education your money can buy
snippet.description: Prepared to go for the dream school — at any cost — Michelle Singletary's daughter writes about her early lesson in economics.

snippet.title: Ukraine, short on military budget, starts fundraising drive
snippet.description: With empty treasury, few bullet-proof vests, citizens open their wallets.

snippet.title: Land-farmed salmon: Coming (temporarily) to a restaurant or store near you
snippet.description: The Freshwater Institute raises salmon in closed tanks. You can get a taste, but not for long.

snippet.title: The Recap: Janet Yellen says full economic recovery could take hold by 2016
snippet.description: Other financial news from the week includes China's 7.4% growth rate, which represents a 24-year low.

snippet.title: As medical providers consolidate, questions about effects on costs, quality of care
snippet.description: A costly legal fight is pushing back against the merger mania gripping the U.S. medical system.

snippet.title: Va. woman's fight tells story of 'ordinary heroes'
snippet.description: When filmmaker Loki Mulholland decided to make a documentary about his mother's role in the civil rights movement, he tricked her into the project.

snippet.title: Year after blast, Texas town ponders new plant
snippet.description: Leaders in a Central Texas town that was devastated last year by a deadly fertilizer plant explosion are contemplating building a new facility, calling it a crucial step toward West's economic recovery.

snippet.title: The top 11 Senate races of 2014
snippet.description: The battle to define state House Speaker Thom Tillis (R) is on in North Carolina.

snippet.title: A year after Rana Plaza: What hasn't changed since the Bangladesh factory collapse
snippet.description: A year after a factory collapsed, what's changed in Bangladesh?

snippet.title: If you build it, will they really come?
snippet.description: If you build it, will they really come?
